org.jetel.data

Class DynamicRecordBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.data.DynamicRecordBuffer

  • public class DynamicRecordBuffer
extends java.lang.Object
    Class implementing DynamicRecordBuffer backed by temporary file - i.e. unlimited size
    Implements FIFO: write & read operations can be interleaved, however it deteriorates performance if data has to be swap to disk (if internal buffer is exhausted).
    Since:
    November 20, 2006

    • Constructor Detail

      • DynamicRecordBuffer

        public DynamicRecordBuffer()
        Constructor of the DynamicRecordBuffer with tmp file created under java.io.tmpdir dir.
        Parameters:
        dataBufferSize -

      • DynamicRecordBuffer

        public DynamicRecordBuffer(int initialBufferSize)
        Constructor of the DynamicRecordBuffer object
        Parameters:
        tmpFilePath - Name of the subdirectory where to create TMP files or NULL (the system default will be used)
        initialBufferSize - The initial size of internal in memory buffer - two buffers of exactly the same size are created - one for reading, one for writing.

    • Method Detail

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Returns:
        true if the buffer is closed and further read/write operations are going to fail, false otherwise

      • setSequentialReading

        public void setSequentialReading(boolean sequentialReading)
        Set to true for performance improvement if writing and reading operations do not interlace. First, all writing operations need to be performed and setEOF() method invoked and after that reading operation can be invoked. This flag ensures that the data records are flushed on disk only if do not fit into memory. This variable can be changed only before init() method invocation.

      • init

        public void init()
        Initializes the buffer. Must be called before any write or read operation is performed.
        Since:
        27.11.2006

      • close

        public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException
        Closes buffer, removes temporary file (is exists)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Description of Exception
        Since:
        September 17, 2002

      • closeTemporarily

        public void closeTemporarily()
        Mark as closed (to prevent locking on reading from buffer). To free buffers, close() method must be called. This method allows reuse of buffer after reset() is called.
        Since:
        Jan 11, 2008

      • waitForEOF

        public void waitForEOF()
                throws java.lang.InterruptedException
        Throws:
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • preExecute

        public void preExecute()

      • reset

        public void reset()
        Clears the buffer. Temp file (if it was created) remains unchanged size-wise and can be reused in the future.

      • reset

        public void reset(boolean deleteTempFile)
        Clears the buffer. Temp file (if it was created) either remains unchanged size-wise or can be deleted.

      • readRecord

        public boolean readRecord(CloverBuffer record)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          java.lang.InterruptedException
        Reads next record from the buffer - FIFO order.
        Parameters:
        record - ByteBuffer into which store data
        Returns:
        true if successful, otherwise false - meaning no more records in buffer (EOF)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Description of the Exception
        java.lang.InterruptedException

      • readRecord

        public DataRecord readRecord(DataRecord record)
                      throws java.io.IOException,
                             java.lang.InterruptedException
        Reads next record from the buffer - FIFO order.
        Parameters:
        record - record into which store data
        Returns:
        record populated with data or NULL if no more records in buffer (EOF)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        java.lang.InterruptedException
        Since:
        27.11.2006

        public boolean readRecord()
                   throws java.io.IOException,

        Throws:
